mdRecord.dcterms:title: Parish Church of St-Jude-on-the-Hill, exterior
St. Jude's
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lutyens, Edwin (English architect, 1869-1944) [architect]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The church ... is a hybrid. Simon Jenkins calls it "the confident application of Queen Anne Revival to traditional church form". Building began in 1909, but the west end was not completed until 1935. The church was consecrated on 7th May 1911. Externally it is 200 feet long and the spire rises 178 feet above the ground. [work]

Inside, the church is 122 feet from the west door to the chancel steps, and forty feet to the highest part of the roof. The ceiling is barrel-vaulted and domed. There are three vaults between the west end and the crossing; a saucer dome over the crossing; one further vault over the crossing and a saucer dome over the sanctuary. The east end finishes in an apse completed in 1923. -- http://www.stjudeonthehill.com/2010/02/guide-to-st-judes.html [work]
